name: Uganda Museum
description: The oldest museum in East Africa, showcasing Uganda's cultural heritage with ethnographic, natural historical, and traditional music collections.

name: Kasubi Tombs
description: UNESCO World Heritage Site and burial grounds for Buganda kings, featuring traditional architecture and important cultural significance.

name: Namugongo Martyrs Shrine
description: Catholic basilica built to honor the Ugandan martyrs who were executed for their faith in 1886, an important pilgrimage site.

name: Bahai Temple
description: The only Bahai temple in Africa, known for its beautiful architecture, serene gardens, and panoramic views of Kampala.

name: Owino Market
description: Kampala's largest and most vibrant market offering everything from fresh produce to clothing and electronics in a bustling atmosphere.

name: Ndere Cultural Centre
description: Cultural center promoting Ugandan traditions through music, dance performances, and cultural exhibitions in a beautiful outdoor setting.

name: Lubiri Palace
description: Former palace of the Kabaka of Buganda with historical significance and beautiful grounds offering insights into Buganda kingdom history.

name: Gaddafi National Mosque
description: Uganda's national mosque with capacity for 15,000 worshippers, offering stunning architecture and panoramic views of Kampala from its minaret.

name: Uganda Wildlife Education Centre
description: Conservation center showcasing Uganda's diverse wildlife with educational programs and animal encounters in naturalistic habitats.

name: Kabaka's Lake
description: The largest man-made lake in Uganda, created in 1880 by Kabaka Mwanga II, offering peaceful boat rides and beautiful scenery.

name: National Theatre
description: Cultural hub hosting theatrical performances, art exhibitions, and creative workshops showcasing Uganda's vibrant arts scene.

name: Namirembe Cathedral
description: The oldest Anglican cathedral in Uganda, offering stunning Gothic architecture, historical significance, and panoramic views of Kampala from its hilltop location.
